results.content:
This course is a fantastic way to learn many of the great features of Bootstrap 4. This is exactly the type of content I was looking for in regards to learning how to quickly code a great looking page using the bootstrap framework. The instructor is clear in his speaking and explains things well. All of the course files are provided so if you run into any issues, it's clear to see where you went wrong.

 You really don’t need to have experience in HTML and CSS in order to take this course, but as the instructor says it is ideal as this course won’t go into the fundamentals of coding, but focuses more on BS4. Great class and look forward to taking more from this instructor.

results.content:
The overall course and individual lectures were well organized and structured. Seeing the final product before beginning and then reviewing the outcome of each of the individual changes provided excellent insight into what was being done. Not only was it a good course about Bootstrap, but it also solidly presented some basic HTML and CSS lessons that are great for beginners. The design of the sample project that was built covered a wide range of real-world design elements without going too far down the proverbial rabbit hole. 

I look forward to taking more of Andy's classes. His teaching style of no fluff, but staying engaging and not skipping over details others might think to be too basic or repetitive is what works best for me.

results.content: This course is very good. Much better than similar courses developing similar sites for twice the time duration and more. I don't understand why other courses take 7 and more hours to cover similar projects. This one can even be shorter removing the introduction sections. On the other hand, this course suffers from a major shortfall, the resolution of the video. Obviously the filming / screen capturing is not done well for even at the highest resolution the text and content is barely visible. It would get worse at lesser resolution. The coding should have been done using a font size 3 or 4 times bigger than the one used. Nevertheless, the course was worth while at least for myself.

results.content: The course definitely walks you through setting up a nicely formatted "landing page".  But there are two negatives with the course.  The first is that nearly all of the sessions have a max screen display of 720p.  With the amount of code being shown at one time, 1080p really should have been available.  Second and my biggest complaint is that there was no mention of how to go about handling the forms that were created on the page.   There should have been some kind of explanation as to how to wire up the forms within a bootstrap environment.  I'm kind of lost in knowing how to make that happen within this kind of environment.

response.content: Hey Richard, thanks for the feedback and the rating. In terms of the forms, I do have a separate course that covers how to create forms within bootstrap. results.content: This was a good course, as advertised: the instructor guides you through making one page (with many different Bootstrap components) and was a good into to Bootstrap 4, I was able to get pretty much everything I was hoping to. The videos and downloads are all written for Bootstrap 4-alpha, but I used Bootstrap 4.5.3 and had no problems. Some of the downloadable code examples seem out of date compared to the videos, and some times you can see the older code in the videos, but what he covers and types out if correct: use that. He covers a little CSS as well (to customize the page) and that was good too.

results.content:
GREAT CONTENT & TUTOR BUT PRESENTATION COULD BE IMPROVED

This course really delivered on giving me the guidance for a creating a great UI with Bootstrap. I felt delighted with the outcome of the course objectives.  Andy is really clear in his explanations of the what and why of Bootstrap 4. 

I would have given this course a 5 star rating if it had been easier to see the coding examples, which are not zoomed-in (and even on a decent-size screen caused my eyes a some difficulty), and are often positioned at the foot of the screen (certainly in much of the CSS code). Zooming-in and positioning in the centre of the view would make a very welcome improvement.

All in all, a very worthwhile and enjoyable course.

results.content:
I really enjoyed this course and it was a lot of fun.  The landing page that we created was really cool, and by doing it alongside the instructor, I learned a lot about Bootstrap that I didn't know.  It definitely gave me a great understanding of the row/column system.  The added bonus for the course was learning how to do some of the cool animations that you see on really well done websites.  By the end of the course, we had sections fading in, out, up, down, and every other direction.  I was amazed at how easy it was to do things that look so complex when viewing them online.
This was a fun course with a great instructor, and definitely well worth the money spent.

results.content: I imagine the instructor is a nice person, and he clearly knows some things about Bootstrap 4. However, there are a number of issues with the course content and delivery that make it incredibly hard to follow. For example, the course files do not match what is provided onscreen. Also does a lot of work "off-screen" and things show up in code that never went over in class. Each video is incredibly frustrating, and after large amounts of research, student is only to find that instructor is not following best practices to begin with (e.g., including extraneous code here, while leaving out important code at other places). Unless done over, from scratch seems as though course does not provide an ideal learning environment.

I wanted to give a 5-star rating because the course is so well-paced and the author's attention to detail is fantastic. However, I had to deduct half of a star because the author uses such a small font in his code editor. For an older person, or somebody with less than perfect eyesight, this makes it difficult to follow along.

I bumped my rating up to 5 stars because the author is accessible. I like his enthusiasm and willingness to help students.
